瘭字的基本解释

瘭
biāo
〔瘭疽〕手指头肚儿急性发炎化脓的病，严重者会引起末节指骨坏死。中医称“蛇头疔”。

瘭字的汉语字典释义

[①]［biāo］
［《廣韻》甫遥切，平宵，幫。］
“漂4”的被通假字。
(1)疽病；疮毒。
(2)比喻祸害。

瘭字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【疒字部】　瘭； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页779第07
〔古文〕?【廣韻】甫遙切【集韻】?遙切，?音猋。瘭疽，病名。【千金方】肉中忽生點，大者如豆，細者如黍粟，甚者如梅李，有根，痛傷應心，久則四面腫泡，曰瘭疽。【後漢·鮮?傳】中國之困，胸背之瘭疽。　又通作漂。【莊子·則陽篇】漂疽疥癰。　又【集韻】匹妙切，音勡。義同。

whitlow
Basic explanation of words
whitlow
biāo
[Necrosis] Acute inflammation and purulent disease in the belly of the fingers. In severe cases, it can cause osteonecrosis of the distal phalanx. It is called "snake head boil" in Chinese medicine.
whitlow
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［biāo］
["Guang Yun" cuts far away, Ping Xiao, help. ]
"Drift 4" was passed falsely.
(1) Gangrene; sore.
(2) It is a metaphor for harm.
whitlow
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Concentration] [The Department of Sui Characters] 　瘭; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 779 No. 07
[Ancient text]? [Guang Yun] Fu Yao cut [Ji Yun]? Remote cut,? Sound. Gangrene, the name of the disease. [Qianjin Fang] Sudden spots in the meat, the big ones are like beans, the fine ones are like millet, and even the plums, with roots, painful to the heart, and swelling on all sides for a long time, called gangrene. [Later Han·Xian? Biography] China's poverty, chest and back gangrene.　Through the drift again. [Zhuangzi·Zeyang Chapter] Drifting gangrene and scabies.　[Jiyun] The horse is wonderfully cut, the sound is 勡. The same meaning.
whitlow
